name: 300th Anniversary of the Death of Charles IX of Sweden
obverse: Charles IX facing left holding a scepter and wearing a sword in a hilt. Around him is a wreath, below, a window sill. Below the window sill is the symbol of the city: a heraldic vase.
reverse: An altar with a flame burning. The altar is surrounded at is base by a vine with leaves. Behind the altar is the city skyline.
description: This medal commemorates the 300th anniversary of the city of Vaasa, Sweden (written as 'Wasa' on the medal) receiving its privileges from King Charles IX.
